\newcommand{\myTFquestion}[3]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1} \\
\indent \textbf {} #2 \textbf {} #3
\end{minipage}
}

\newcommand\SpecifyBlock[1][]{%
	\parbox[t][12.4cm][c]{7.8cm}{%
	\begin{description}
  \setkeys{TFQuestions}{#1}%
	\end{description}
	}
	\vspace{-0.2cm}
}

\newcommand{\myshortquestion}[5]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1} \\
\indent \textbf {} #2 \textbf {} #3 \textbf {} #4 \textbf {} #5
\end{minipage}
}

\newcommand{\myquestion}[4]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\begin{description}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\item [a] #2
\vspace{-0.2cm}
\item [b] #3
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\item [c] #4
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\end{description}
\end{minipage}
}

\begin{textblock}{8}(8,0)
\textblocklabel{picture8,0}
\begin{tiny}graham 3\end{tiny}\\\SpecifyBlock[
Question1 = {1. Planners shouldn't think about users' needs.},
Question2 = {2. Clear goals make it is easier to act.},
Question3 = {3. A written plan is not useful.},
Question4 = {4. Written plans are shown to banks.},
Question5 = {5. The boss shouldn't listen to workers.},
Question6 = {6. The boss needs to talk about goals.},
Question7 = {7. Kendall's 1st company wasn't successful.},
Question8 = {8. Kendall's 2nd company was easier to sell.},
Question9 = {9. His goals probably became clearer later.},
Question10 = {10. He probably didn't do much planning.},
]\par
\vspace{-0.2cm}
\end{textblock}
